did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.physdesc: This collection consists of 3 folders in one Hollinger box and 6 items in one flat box.
did.abstract: This collection consists primarily of deeds, indentures, financial records and wills of John Bowman and his descendants of Rockingham County.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Bowman family papers, Collection #4019, Special Collections, Carrier Library, James Madison University, Harrisonburg, Va. Deposited by the Harrisonburg-Rockingham Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Deposited by the Harrisonburg-Rockingham Historical Society in April, 1999.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: John Bowman was issued a Land Office Exchange Treasury Warrant for 374 acres in a section of Rockingham County, VA called "the forest" in 1811. His descendants included David, Joseph, Alpheus, and Solon Bowman. He also had connections with George Keezel and Charles E. Long.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of three folders of deeds, indentures, financial records, wills and a few other miscellaneous documents 1765-[1850-1990]-1998, relevant to John Bowman and his descendants David, Joseph, Alpheus, Solon, and others. John Bowman was issued a Land Office Exchange Treasury Warrant for 374 acres in a section of Rockingham County, VA called "the forest" in 1811. Some documents indicate connections with George Keezel and Charles E. Long. Six rolls of names and amounts record subscriptions for erecting a new Rader's Church in 1878-79.

did.physdesc: Includes naturalization document for George Bauman.
Pertains to settlement of Bowman and Long estates
Six subscription rolls of names and amounts for erecting a new church at or near Rader's Church
